messages.message: can we just delete the google calendar and go off of https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_YIkXbxu7NE9FD5SQlJs5qj114LD-6yK__-qMA3sWis/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.variaokk1brm as the source of truth?

Ik slack has this rotation app that pings the next person up in the channel weekly and it's ez to setup but not sure how we can add it.. https://instabase.slack.com/marketplace/A02MJR2A7TQ-rotation-app

we also have an in-house tool for managing on-call rotations https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENG/pages/2364145687/Aegis+-+Instabase+s+on-caller+assistant

but this would require the rotation to be managed on Opsgenie
@jaden it seems that this app (https://rotation.app/#pricing) requires you to pay if you have more than 5 users in the rotation, which we will outgrow very soon

ok for now, i asked gemini to write a script to convert the table into a csv, which i then imported into google calendar

so starting next week, you should see the on-call person in the "Cypress on-call" calendar

ohh that's pretty cool! Aegis does sound nice but seems like an overkill for what we need since I assume this on call is just for cypress tests?

I didn't know there was a paid plan oops :facepalm:  Thanks for looking into it Serena! I wonder how difficult it'll be to just update the 5 users every 5 weeks, but ig there has to be some level of manual work one way or another just a matter of slack vs google calendar :smile:

> seems like an overkill for what we need since I assume this on call is just for cypress tests?
yeah, so that's why i'm hesitant to move to Aegis + Opsgenie too :sweat_smile:

> ig there has to be some level of manual work one way or another just a matter of slack vs google calendar
:yupyupyup:
